meanings.definition: An introduction to something more substantial
meanings.sent1: The overture to the book gave a brief summary of what to expect.
meanings.sent2: The overture of the meeting set the stage for the important discussions ahead.
meanings.sent3: The overture to the party was a fun game to break the ice.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the overture to a wonderful friendship.
meanings.sent5: The overture of the movie was so captivating that everyone was hooked from the start.

meanings.definition: A musical introduction to an opera or other large musical work
meanings.sent1: The overture played by the orchestra signaled the beginning of the opera.
meanings.sent2: The overture by the pianist was a beautiful start to the concert.
meanings.sent3: The overture to the musical was so catchy that it stayed in everyone's head.
meanings.sent4: The overture of the symphony was like a magical spell cast on the audience.
meanings.sent5: The overture of the ballet was so graceful that it brought tears to the eyes of the spectators.

meanings.definition: A proposal or offer intended to open negotiations or establish a relationship
meanings.sent1: His overture to collaborate on the project was well-received by the team.
meanings.sent2: The company's overture for a partnership was met with enthusiasm by the investors.
meanings.sent3: The overture to join forces with the competitor was unexpected but intriguing.
meanings.sent4: Her overture to mend their friendship was a step in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The overture to reconcile differences between the two parties was a diplomatic move.
